wikipedia_page.main: Mary Dawson Turner, before her marriage Mary Palgrave (1774–1850), was an English artist. She is known for her series of portraits, making etchings from drawings collected by her husband.

response: *Portrait of Palgrave by his mother-in-law Mary Dawson Turner, née Palgrave.
Etchings of Manby by his friend Mary Dawson Turner are in the National Portrait Gallery.

In 1796, the year he joined his father's bank, Turner married Mary (1774–17 March 1850), the daughter of William Palgrave of Norfolk. She became a notable portrait artist under her married name Mary Dawson Turner and 78 of her drawings (as etchings) are in the possession of the National Portrait Gallery in London. The couple had 11 children:
